app.footer: WatchMeGrow.care is supported by the University of New South Wales. It focuses on general developmental milestones, as well as language and social skills.

landing.heading: All children grow and develop at their own pace.
landing.explanation: WatchMeGrow.care helps track your child's progress and provides information about healthy development.
landing.ages: This app is designed for children aged approximately {{minAge}} to {{maxAge}}

generalInformation.intro: For general information on growth and development for children from birth to 5 years please see the following link:

details.yourEmailAddress: Your email address (so we can send you the results)

doctorDetails.explanationPara1: Please include your health practitioner’s email address if you would like them to receive these results.
doctorDetails.explanationPara2: Alternatively, the results will also be sent to you via email for you to print and take to your health professional.

cdc6.reach: Does your child try to get things that are in reach?
cdc6.affection: Does your child show affection to caregivers?
cdc6.respondToSounds: Does your child respond to sounds around them?
cdc6.difficultyMouth: Does your child have difficulty getting things to their mouth?
cdc6.vowelSounds: Can your child make vowel sounds? (“ah”, “eh”, “oh”)
cdc6.roll: Can your child roll over in either direction?
cdc6.squealing: Does your child laugh or make squealing sounds?
cdc6.tightMuscles: Is your child stiff or show signs of tight muscles, or show symptoms of being very floppy or like a rag doll?
cdc6.lostSkills: Has your child lost skills they once had?
